intro: Psoralea bituminosa subsp. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It has small, bean-like pods that contain several seeds, and it is adapted to withstand drought conditions. The species is of interest in ecological studies due to its role in nitrogen fixation and its potential medicinal properties.
